detailsOfAchievement: Al-Ameen Mission has been rendering its service in the field of education for more than 30 years and have developed expertise in the same. The Mission has produced many doctors and engineers with the support from the Ministry of Minority Affairs, Govt. of India. Al-Ameen Mission makes a sincere effort to achieve success by promoting integrated development programme especially for the poor and meritorious minority students through carefully planned activities and providing modern scientific education. Al-Ameen Mission always strives for the betterment of the society by nurturing the needy and helpless children because it believes these are uncut diamonds which only need proper polishing. In our effort to bring about a qualitative change in the lives of students, we have received all sorts of co-operation from all. A healthy mind in a healthy body is more desirable than anything else in life. Al-Ameen Mission has taken much care to improve health and sanitation through adequate awareness. Al-Ameen Mission creates leaders in different fields through education who will subsequently be the change agents for the society. Al-Ameen Mission dedicatedly try to uplift the standards of education of its students through various activities and organising workshop. It provided all the necessary support that the young fertile brain needs to germinate their knowledge and wisdom. The Mission is playing a pivotal role to spread modern education among the unprivileged section of the society. With much enthusiasm and grace, the Independence Day, Republic Day and other important calender dates are observed. Cultural programmes and Seminars are organised throughout the year for all-round development of the students. 24 hours ambulance service is on for the students of Al-Ameen Mission as well as the inhabitants of adjacent villages. Due importance is given regularly regarding games and sports ensuring the participation of all students. A children park has already been set up at Khalatpur, Howrah Campus for the refreshment of the students. Al-Ameen Mission expresses gratitude and sincere thanks to all persons and experts for sharing their views and expressions in various programmes conducted by Al-Ameen Mission. We also accord our heartfelt gratitude to all well-wishers for the co-operation and support they have extended in materializing our ideas.

title: ALAKENDU BODH NIKETAN RESIDENTIAL
detailsOfAchievement: ALAKENDU BODH NIKETAN RESIDENTIAL (ABNR), the pioneer and first residential institute, are non profitable NGO, was launched in the year 1977, under the initiative of late Dr Bimalendu Narayan Roy founder director, recipient of National award and many distinguished awards. ABNR aims at creating and strengthening rights based special education programme which helps to create community awareness and mainstreaming of the differently abled children. The organization develops and implements highest quality programmes, initiatives and services to achieve its mission. ABNR AND ITS UNITS: ABNR Main unit in Kolkata Special school for Mentally Challenged (boys & Girls). Vocational training for Mentally Challenged Adults (18 years & onwards). Training Course in Special Education viz. D. ED. SE (MR) under RCI & Manipal University. DPEP Programme. ABNR Jemo Unit, Murshidabad DPEP Programme SAMARTH by National Trust. ADIP (appliances Scheme). ABNR Sonada Unit, a rural based project in the hilly area of Darjeeling & residential. ABNR Khirpai Unit, a rural based project in Paschim Midapore& residential. DPEP is going here run by SSA Govt. of WB. ABNR Anuradha Unit, exclusive project for Girls & Adult Women& residential. MODES OF SERVICES IN SPECIAL SCHOOL: Early interventions and Home Based Programming, O.P.D., Community Based Rehabilitation Education, Vocational Training, Model School. Residential Services, Special School Services. Speech Therapy, Hydrotherapy, Physiotherapy, Occupational Therapy, Music Therapy, Behaviour Therapy, Yogic-Play Therapy, counseling, Multi Sensory Training, I.Q. assessment, Special Education. Day School, Open School, Integrated Education. Terminal assessment, Longitudinal follow -up, Transition, Vocational training. CARE GROUP: Physical management. Different therapies. Preparation of Care Giver. Augmentatives and Alternative communication. Independent in Performing Skill. MODES OF SERVICES IN VOCATIONAL UNIT : TRANSITION Adult day programme, community based services programme Vocational training. Adult with development disability, Adult with motor disability, Adult with learning disability. Open employment, Sheltered employment, Supported employment. THE VOCATIONAL UNIT CONSISTS WITH THE UNITS OF Weaving, Carpentry, Printing & binding, Candle making, Stitching & Embroidery, Clay modeling, Art., Music & Dance, Computer Training, Sheltered workshop, Library facilities, Teachersâ€™ Training Course. In spite of that ABNR celebrating social integration programme, play and cultural activities and many festivals along with World Disabled Day and National Day for Mentally Challenged.

detailsOfAchievement: AICMED started its journey in 1987 with the primary purpose of spreading adult literacy in West Bengal and beyond. It marked a niche in the said field in the â€™90s. Subsequently, keeping in mind the needs and aspirations of the underprivileged people who are basically illiterate, it took up in its stride many other significant projects and some of which are still on their way to completion. The following list offers a glimpse of some major projects undertaken by AICMED: Most significant adult education project in 1989 to1990 funded by HRD, Govt. of India covering seven district of West Bengal with 510 centres covering 15,257 adult illiterate person. Publication of a Bengali Anthology of Neo-literatesâ€” â€œChokher Aloyâ€ in 1991 with the financial assistance from Department of Education, Ministry of HRD, Govt. of India, has been acclaimed as a pioneering endeavour. Environmental Impact Studies of Accelerated Development of Minor Irrigation Project under WRIDD, Govt. of West Bengal, in 30 designated blocks in West Bengal, funded by World Bank, Consulting Engineering Services (CES) has been successfully completed in 2008-09. PRIA/ DFID funded WBCSSP Project in Birbhum district, W.B, started in 2008 to 2009. CAPART funded ongoing project on â€œParticipatory Approach to Biomass-based Biogas Generation and use by the Rural Poorâ€ in 10 villages of WB has been started in 2008. CAPART sponsored project on â€œAlternative Ways to Combat Arsenic Pollution of Drinking Waterâ€ has been successfully carried out in Chapra Block, Nadia, West Bengal during 2003-2005. â€œCity Level Programme of Action for Street and Working Children (CLPOA)â€ has been started in 2001 and is still continuing in several wards in Kolkata. Training programme was organized for women for helping them use Traditional Herbs for Community Health Care and Livestock Rearing at Bakreswar, Birbhum, West Bengal, under the financial patronage from ICPRD, New Delhi, on July 22, 2002 Condensed Course for Rural Women was organized at Chapra, Nadia, West Bengal under the auspices of The Central Social Welfare Board during December 1999-November 2001. A Writersâ€™ Workshop had been organized jointly with ICSSR and DAE, Govt. of India, at Viswabharati, Shantiniketan, Birbhum during 2nd-9th October, 1988 Since 1999 till to 2011, 6 projects have been completed with the help of Ministry of Environment , Govt. of India effective beneficiaries being 100 of school children 50 farmers 35 rural women and the other persons The financial help of DST, Govt. of India a project on â€œLivelihood promotion of Tribal people in Birbhum district of West Bengal is being implemented now since January 2012, in a total Tribal village of 80 family

detailsOfAchievement: Free English Medium School for the poor students

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Provided educational services to the poor students.In this year this organization worked by its own contribution.
Apart from the previous programs, in this year this organisation conducted a community development project which was related to drinking water. We have done all the programs from our own contribution

We have observed that among the people of rural areas, Hygiene care especially for the ladies, sanitization, child marriage, no birth control, drug addiction, child labor etc are the burning issues. We have tried to aware people by door to door campaign in several interior areas. Apart from regular studies to spread Computer knowledge to the poor students, we have distributed Computer books among the students . In this year this organization worked by its own contribution.

Apart from the previous program, in this year we worked for the children from the backward classes of the villages. To fulfill our motto we have conducted an overall survey among the school going backward classes students in several village areas, one by one. We have contributed of our own to continue with the aforesaid programs.

In this year to fulfill our target we have started a free proposed CBSE School for the underprivileged children at Block: Kharibari, Dist: Darjeeling. Name of our School is Minoti Devi Memorial English Medium School. Presently we have started our preprimary section (LKG) and searching for CSR or Govt. funds, to upgrade it. In Skill Development training sector, we have started Hotel Management training. We have done all these programs form our own.

Presently entire world is suffering from Covid 19 pandemic. During to lockdown almost all the people were bound to stay at home. So many people are still jobless. As a social worker we have tried our level best to stay by the side in times of grief. We have collected some donation and distributed some food, medicine, tripol, cloths etc to the poor people.

B.A. seeks to explore interdisciplinary art forms and diverse artists and audience communities from all over the country. B.A. conducts state wise theater workshop that involve maximum representation of participants from all backgrounds. The workshops are open to students, corporate, artists and academics. detailsOfAchievement: Human Resource Barasat Sampark is recruiting in the staffs who have micro finance or microcredit background particularly in West Bengal context. As the organization has crossed the initial stage its head office level staffs and Area Managers have past experience in working with established MFIs in West Bengal. Recruitments are done basically with the people of MFI background with qualification of min H.S. for P.O. to above for all other positions, right now by reference of known people of MFI, but in future through newspaper advertisement. MIS Decision making, Administrative, outreach, portfolio and financial data is generated regularly and control system used it regularly. The micro credit MIS formats are more or less standardized and covers information like no of out reach, security and loan disbursed, weekly realizable and realized etc. Now Sampark has computerized MIS. Education Every one knows that education is the backbone of the nation. Lack of education no development and upliftment of the society is possible. Recognizing the importance of providing education services to the masses , SAMPARK has taken several concrete stapes in the direction . One such step is that SAMPARK has formed child guardian committees which strives for self sustenance for educational system .Remedial classes for outgoing children are another significant measure undertaken by SAMPARK . About 51 children in the age group of 5 to12 years of age including majority of female children were admitted in formal school . SAMPARK provided books for poor intelligent students . Health and Sanitation Health is another major of concern where SAMPARK has maximized its efforts . SAMPARK health program is completely community driven and ensures diversification in health , sanitation and nutrition The core activities in this sector by SAMPARK are Identification of potential village health guides and providing them training and exposure . Propagating and sanitation and cleanliness habits . Construction of toilets and bathrooms . Subsidized distribution of safe drinking water . Maintenance and beautification of tubewell . Organizing regular health camp . Orientation on awareness building training on personal hygiene and Sanitation and nutrition no 326 Free medical checkup no 126 CAPACITY BUILDING Over the past few years, Sampark has learnt that capacity building of the staff is one of the key components of its development strategy . Hence, training has been considered as an important strategy to enhance the proficiency and expertise of the staff. It never compromises on the capacity building of its staff. Micro Credit Programme Micro credit has been universally recognized as one of the most powerful tools to emancipate people from the shackles of destitution and hunger. Poor women create self-employment with loans taken from Sampark making them selfreliant. Sampark norm of lending out loans has been made extremely poor friendly so that it can bring more and more people under its purview. The credit deliverance is made through the methodology of joint liability group model.

detailsOfAchievement: 1. We are working with the vulnerable adolesent girls to develop the awareness among them regarding unsafe migration and missing. We help for rescue, rehabilitation and reintegration of the trafficked girls in their family and the community. In 8 blocks of north 24 parganas. We also work in Seven brick kilns of Barasat - II block under North 24 Parganas for main streaming the children of the brick kilns workers form 0 to 10 years for main straming them in the formal education. We also work with the children of 11 to 18 years for developing functional literacy among them for reading, writting and airthmatic knowledge so they can use this education in their professional works. 2. We work with the women and develop their self help group and provide their loan through our Micro Credit Programme for their livelihood development. 3. We are working with German Leprocy and Tuberculosis Relief Association for providing DOTs to eradicate Tuberculosis from our socities. We organised Health camps on preventing health and eye camps for helping the poor eye patients for getting eye operation through govt programmes. 4. We work on environment awareness among the community regarding Global warming and climate change. In connection with this programme we help to participating afforestration programme in our working areas with the help of the govt. afforestration programme.
